HALF-LIFE 2

 This game is what i can only describe as:
Timeless.

No matter what Year, month, week or day this game will always stand as the game that inspired so many people.
This game is peoples childhoods.
In every aspect of this game its a thrilling experience.

Engaging STORY.
Breathtaking graphics for a 2004 game. (Other games at this time looked like San Andreas.)
Immersive world.
Gameplay is top notch.
Makes FULL USE of its physics engine.

Now, lets gush over the real thing i love about this game.

The Combine.

The combine stood out to me as nothing id ever seen before.
Instead of your typical scifi-alien race who destroy worlds;
The combine is different.
They ENSLAVE.
They COMBINE.
The combine take other aliens and COMBINE them into itself. One single being.
Earth is but another planet and species they can enslave to do their bidding.
Most creatures the combine have enslaved have an AMAZING design.

Strider. Tall, three legged, menace.
Gunship. Flying shooting nightmare.

The way the combine have enslaved humanity is interesting too.
Starve the residents of earth.
Turn them into mindless synthetic monsters with no free will.
Drain earths resources until its an empty, dead husk.

The beta version of half-life 2 shows this aspect glorified to its FULLEST.
The beta always intrigued me to the combines ways.

I could go ON AND ON about how MUCH i love this game.
But every other review before me has said it all in detail.
So, im going to just say it.

Half-life 2 will never be forgotten.

And i know that there will NEVER be another game as wonderful, inspiring, and creative as:

                                        
                                                     H Œª L F  -  L I F E  ¬≤

Thank you, Valve.

Doesn't really hold up anymore, I forgot how overrated and safe Valve made the sequel. The open world sections with the boat, and buggy are just straight up awful. It's a fun experience for what it is, but don't expect a masterpiece like HL1. The final sections of the game were so obviously rushed too, and the ending is still as bad as it was in 2004.

While I didn't enjoy it as much as the first part of the series, I'd still recommend it to experience a great milestone of video game history.
